nodes.documentation:
@dev The fallback function is called when ether is sent to the contract, it
 simply calls `doTakerPayment()` . No tokens are created when takers contribute.
 `_owner`. Payable is a required solidity modifier for functions to receive
 ether, without this modifier functions will throw if ether is sent to them

onTransfer
onApprove

nodes.documentation:
@dev The fallback function is called when ether is sent to the contract, it
 simply calls `doTakerPayment()` . No tokens are created when takers contribute.
 `_owner`. Payable is a required solidity modifier for functions to receive
 ether, without this modifier functions will throw if ether is sent to them

nodes.name: proxyPayment
onTransfer
onApprove
onBurn

nodes.documentation:
@notice `onlyOwner` can upgrade the controller contract
 @param _newControllerAddress The address that will have the token control logic
nodes.name: upgradeController

nodes.documentation: @dev enableBurning - Allows the owner to activate burning on the underlying token contract
nodes.name: enableBurning
claimTokens

params._token: The address of the token contract that you want to recover

constructor.details: There are several checks to make sure the parameters are acceptable

params._tokenAddress: Address of the token contract this contract controls
params._vaultAddress: The address that will store the donated funds

enableBurning(bool).details: enableBurning - Allows the owner to activate burning on the underlying token contract

isOwner().details: Returns true if the caller is the current owner.

onApprove(address,address,uint256).return: False if the controller does not authorize the approval

onBurn(address,uint256).return: False if the controller does not authorize the approval

onTransfer(address,address,uint256).return: False if the controller does not authorize the transfer

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

params._owner: Does not do anything, but preserved because of MiniMe standard function.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner.     * NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

params._newControllerAddress: The address that will have the token control logic

claimTokens(address).notice: ///////This method can be used by the owner to extract mistakenly  sent tokens to this contract.

onApprove(address,address,uint256).notice: Notifies the controller about an approval, for this Campaign all  approvals are allowed by default and no extra notifications are needed

onBurn(address,uint256).notice: Notifies the controller about a burn attempt. Initially all burns are disabled. Upgraded Controllers in the future will allow token holders to claim the pledged ETH

onTransfer(address,address,uint256).notice: Notifies the controller about a transfer. Transfers can only happen to whitelisted addresses

proxyPayment(address).notice: //////////////`proxyPayment()` allows the caller to send ether to the Campaign but does not create tokens. This functions the same as the fallback function.
